arm_group.description: images of lesions and liver will be compared to histology.

brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to improve stratification of patients with chronic liver
      disease through non-invasive detection and characterization of small liver tumors and liver
      fibrosis by means of using multi spectral CT.

clinical_study.brief_title: Stratification of Patients With Chronic Liver Disease Using Multi Spectral CT

detailed_description.textblock:
This is a type IV phase study, in which an FDA approved imaging device currently used for
      studying chronic liver disease has not yet been validated.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  adult patient undergoing CT scan for/suspicion of hepatocellular carcinoma.

          -  Patients should be scheduled for/or should have obtained a multiphasic MRI of the
             liver.

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  patients < 18 years old.

          -  history of allergy to intravenous contrast.

          -  patients at risk for contrast-induced-nephropathy,

          -  pregnant patients.

intervention.description: Analysis of the background liver and liver lesions will be performed on Multi Spectral CT images and compared to histology.

clinical_study.official_title: Stratification of Patients With Chronic Liver Disease Using Multi Spectral CT

overall_official.affiliation: Director of CT, Massachusetts General Hospital

authority: United States: Food and Drug Administration

primary_outcome.measure: Detection of hepatocellular carcinoma on Multi Spectral CT
primary_outcome.time_frame: confirmation with focal biopsy and or/contrast-enhanced MRI of the liver acquired within 6 months prior to the multi spectral CT scan.

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

responsible_party.investigator_title: Director of CT, Associate Professor of Radiology Harvard Medical School

clinical_study.study_design: Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Single Blind (Investigator), Primary Purpose: Diagnostic
